#text: What is the discretionary clause that can be added to a SOSL query to specify the information to be returned in the text search result?

span.em: RETURNING is an optional clause that can be added to a SOSL query to specify the information returned in the text search result. Use the RETURNING clause to restrict the results that are returned from the search() call.

label.#text: Server-side calls from custom Lightning components

span.em: Visualforce pages with standard controllers do not need Apex code.

p.em: Lightning components use JavaScript on the client side and can use Apex to make calls to the server side.

#text: Describe how to write and when to use Apex classes and interfaces

em.p: By using Apex code, a developer may implement: Web services, email services, complex validation over multiple objects, complex business processes that are not supported by workflow, custom transactional logic.

#text: A PageReference is a reference to an instantiation of a page. Which of the following are valid means of instantiating a PageReference?

span.em: Use Page.existingPageName to refer to a PageReference for a Visualforce page that has already been saved in your organization.

p.em: You can also instantiate a PageReference object for the current page with the currentPage ApexPages method: PageReference pageRef = ApexPages.currentPage();

em.p: Creates a PageReference to any page that is hosted on the Force.com platform by using PageReference pageRef = new PageReference(‘URL’);

#text: An administrator needs to get records with locations saved in geolocation or address fields as individual latitude and longitude values.
Which SOQL statement accomplishes this goal?

label.#text: SELECT Id, Name, Location__latitude__s, Location__longitude__s FROM CustomObject__c
SELECT Id, Name, Location__latitude__c, Location__longitude__c FROM CustomObject__c
SELECT Id, Name, Location__r.latitude__c, Location__r.longitude__c FROM CustomObject__c
SELECT Id, Name, Location__r.latitude, Location__r.longitude FROM CustomObject__c

span.em: Records with locations saved in geolocation or address fields as individual latitude and longitude values can be retrieved by appending ‘__latitude__s’ or ‘__longitude__s’ to the field name, instead of the usual ‘__c’.

#text: Which data type is appropriate for a numerical value of 726.234 stored in the variable totalCost?

span.em: The Decimal data type is used for storing numbers that include a decimal point and is most suitable for working with currency values. Currency fields in sObjects are automatically assigned the type Decimal. Double is a 64-bit numeric data type that can be used to store numbers that contain decimal points but offers lesser functionality compared to Decimal.

p.em: Integer and Long cannot include decimal points. Numeric is an invalid data type.

#text: A recruitment application is being developed to manage job vacancies and job applications. The business wants to display the number of applications for each job vacancy, and the number should be automatically updated when applications are created or deleted. Also, the parent job vacancy record's security settings should not be inherited by the job application record. Which of the following options are the most suitable for this requirement?

label.#text: Create a master-detail relationship between the two objects.
Use Process Builder to invoke a flow that counts the job applications and updates the field on the parent record.
Use Flow Builder to count the job applications and update the field on the parent record.
Create a lookup relationship between the two objects.

span.em: A lookup relationship can be created between the Job Vacancy and Job Application objects. An after-save record-triggered flow and a before-delete record-triggered flow can be used to update the count field accordingly on the job vacancy record when job applications are created and deleted.

p.em: A master-detail relationship cannot be used since the detail record would inherit the sharing and security settings of the master record. Process Builder is not required to invoke a flow; a flow can be triggered automatically. Besides, a process cannot be invoked when a record is deleted.

#text: In Apex, an expression is a construct made up of variables, operators, and method invocations that evaluates to a single value. Which of the following are valid Apex expressions?

span.em: Apex expressions can be a literal expression, a new sObject, Apex object, list, set, or map, or a static or instance method invocation. future is an annotation to identify methods that are executed asynchronously.

#text: How can a developer check if the current user is able to delete the current object?

label.#text: Use the Deletable() method of the SObjectResult Class
Use the canDelete() method of the DescribeSObjectResult Class
Use the isDeletable() method of the DescribeSObjectResult Class
Use the canDelete() method of the SObjectResult Class

span.em: The isDeletable() method of the DescribeSObjectResult Class returns true if the object can be deleted by the current user, false otherwise. Other useful methods of DescribeSObjectResult include isAccessible(), isCreateable, and isSearchable(). There are many more.

#text: What will be the output if the code below is executed when the value of testRawScore variable is 75?

span.em: Since there is no ELSE statement in the code, the IF statements will continue to be evaluated, even if one of the conditions is met. Since the value of testRawScore (75) is greater than 70, the code within the third IF statement assigns the value ‘C’ to the ‘gradeEqual’ variable. But since 75 is also greater than 60,  the last IF statement assigns the value ‘D’ to the ‘gradeEqual’ variable, replacing the prior value. As a result, the final value of the variable is ‘D’.

#text: A developer requires a variable numberOfStudents with a constant value of 25 that is accessible only within the Apex class in which it is defined. Which of the following is the best variable declaration?

span.em: From the statement itself, a variable numberOfStudents is required that has a constant (STATIC, FINAL) value of 25 (INTEGER) and is accessible only within (PRIVATE) the Apex class in which it is defined.

p.em: Global or public variables become accessible outside the class. Protected variables become accessible by classes that extend the class where they are defined in.

#text: What will be the result if the code below is executed when the variable testRawScore is 75?

span.em: Repeated ELSE-IF statements will navigate down through each IF and ELSE IF statement UNTIL ONE of the expressions evaluates to true. Even though the last else-if statement contains a condition that is true, it is not executed. The code stops after evaluating the prior statement and assigning the value 'Grade C' to the variable 'gradeEqual'.

#text: Which of the following statements are true when defining Apex classes?

label.#text: It is optional to specify an access modifier in declaring a top-level class.
It is optional to specify an access modifier in declaring inner class.
A top-level class can have multiple levels of inner classes.
It is required to specify an access modifier in declaring top-level class.

span.em: It is mandatory to specify one of the access modifiers when declaring a top-level class, while it is not mandatory to specify an access modifier when declaring inner classes. You must use one of the access modifiers (such as public or global) in the declaration of a top-level class. The private access modifier declares that the class is only known locally. The default access for inner classes is private. If the access modifier is not specified for an inner class, it is considered private. Inner classes can only be one level deep.

input.name: check

#text: Which of the following statements about delete and undelete DML operations are true?

label.#text: In a master-detail relationship, child records are deleted when the parent record is deleted.
All custom lookup relationships that have not been replaced can be restored.
Association between an opportunity and a quote cannot be restored after deletion.
The undelete operation does not restore the record associations for parent cases.
Parent and child account records are supported by the undelete operation.

span.em: Salesforce only restores lookup relationships that have not been replaced. For example, if an asset is related to a different product prior to the original product record being undeleted, that asset-product relationship is not restored. Undelete can also restore opportunity-quote associations.

p.em: Cascading deletions are supported; if a parent record is deleted, its children are automatically deleted, as long as each child record can be deleted, as in case of master-detail relationships. The undelete operation restores the record associations for parent cases (as specified in the ‘Parent Case’ field on a case).

label.#text: SELECT LeadSource, COUNT(Name) FROM Lead GROUP BY LeadSource
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Lead GROUP BY LeadSource

span.em: A GROUP BY clause can be used with COUNT(fieldName) to allow analyzing records and returning summary reporting information.

#text: What are reasons for using a static method or variable?

label.#text: To use a method or variable without instantiating its class
To create a utility method in a class
To access values of instance member variables of its class
To store information that is shared across instances of a class
To persist a variable value beyond the context of a single transaction

span.em: Since all instances of the same class share a single copy of a static variable, it can be used to store information within the context of a transaction. For example, a recursive trigger can use a static variable to determine when to exit the recursion by conditionally setting its value. A static method can be used as a utility method and is not subject to instance member variables. A static method or variable is accessed without instantiating the defining class.

p.em: Static variables only persist within the context of a single transaction. Static methods cannot access values of instance member variables of its class.

#text: To fulfill a business requirement, a formula field of a child object has been used in a roll-up summary field of a Master object. Will the roll-up summary field function correctly?

label.#text: Yes, using formula fields in a roll-up summary is fully supported
Yes, if the formula field is not referring to another field in a different object
Yes, only if the formula field has a numeric value
No, using formula fields in a roll-up summary is not supported.

span.em: A roll-up summary field can calculate the value of formula fields unless:

p.em: Number, currency, percent, date, and date/time fields are available depending on the roll-up type.

#text: Describe the capabilities and use cases for roll-up summary fields.
– The formula field contains cross-object field references
– The formula field contains functions that derive values dynamically, such as NOW or TODAY

#text: A company would like to send record information to a legacy system when a criteria is met. A developer can accomplish this requirement by using:

Outbound messaging uses the notifications() call to send SOAP messages over HTTP(S) to a designated endpoint when triggered by a workflow rule. After you set up outbound messaging, when a triggering event occurs, a message is sent to the specified endpoint URL. The message contains the fields specified when you created the outbound message. Once the endpoint URL receives the message, it can take the information from the message and process it.
NOTE: Outbound Messaging is a distinguishing capability of Workflow Rules, so any time outbound messaging is required, a workflow rule is the likely solution.
Describe the capabilities of the declarative process automation features.

#text: Given the following options, what are the valid ways to declare a collection variable?

span.em: Expressions can be a new sObject, Apex object, List, Set, or Map. In the given options, the Map of accounts and List of accounts declared using the List keyword or array notation (square brackets) are all valid expressions for declaring collection variables.

p.em: A proper declaration syntax for a Set, applicable also for the other collection data types, is: new Set<Account>(). There is no Array datatype in Apex.

#text: How can a developer check if a user has read access to a field and the field can be displayed on a Visualforce page?

label.#text: Call the IsAccessible() method of Schema.DescribeSObjectResult to verify field level read permission
Call the isReadable() method of Schema.SObjectResult to verify field level read permission
Call the isViewable() method of Schema.DescribeFieldResult to verify field level read permission
Call the isAccessible() method of Schema.DescribeFieldResult to verify field level read permission

span.em: The isAccessible method of Schema.DescribeFieldResult can be called to check the current user’s read access for a field.

#text: Which of the following statements about defining an Apex Class are true?

label.#text: The keyword [class] followed by the name of the class is necessary
An access modifier is required in the declaration of a top-level class
A definition modifier is required in the top-level class.
A developer may add optional extensions and/or implementations.
The keyword [class] is required if no access modifier is present.

span.em: To define a class, an access modifier (such as public or global) must be used in the declaration of a top-level class. An access modifier is not required in the declaration of an inner class. Definition modifiers (such as virtual, abstract) are optional. Whether an access modifier has been specified or not, the keyword [class] is always mandatory.

Use the SOQL.execute(string) with a query specified in the string
Use the Database.search(string) with a query specified in the string
Use the Database.query(string) with a query specified in the string

span.em: Static variables declared in an Apex class can be directly accessed without instantiating using the following syntax: ClassName.StaticVariableName. A static method or variable does not require an instance of the class in order to run. Static variables are not methods, so no parentheses are needed.

The [with/without sharing] keyword should only be defined in outer classes.
[without sharing] will be the default for the inner class
The innerClass inherits the sharing setting of the containerClass.

span.em: “without sharing” is the default sharing setting for Apex classes. Inner classes do not inherit the sharing setting from their container class.

#text: What method can be used to obtain metadata information about all the sObjects in an organization and their fields?

span.em: The getGlobalDescribe() method can be used to return a map of all sObject names (keys) to sObject tokens (values) for the standard and custom objects defined in an organization. The describeSObjects() method can be used to obtain metadata (field list and object properties) for the specified sObject or array of sObjects. The sObjects need to be specified when using this method. There are no methods named describeObjects() and getGlobalSObjects().

span.em: In Salesforce, some standard objects do not support DML operations but can still be queried. Profile and Record Type are both examples of these.

#text: What is the correct syntax for a Do While procedural loop?

p.em: The do-statement block needs curly braces and it does not check the Boolean condition statement until after the first loop is executed, therefore, the do-statement block is always executed once. Note that this is different from how most other code blocks are written. For code blocks starting with “if”, “while”, and “for”, the condition in parentheses is placed before the curly braces in the code because it is checked immediately. Since do-while loops first perform the action once and THEN check the condition, the condition is placed after the code block.

#text: A developer needs to initialize a numerical value of 17. What data type should the developer use?

span.em: Integer is a 32-bit number that does not include a decimal point. Using a String will lose the numeric value of 17, so it may not be used in numerical/arithmetic operations.

#text: Steadfast Insurance Inc. has a custom object Claim to track insurance claims for its team members. When a team member creates a claim record, an approval process is started which is used by the insurance manager to approve or reject the claim. In order to assist the manager, a team member's claim limit, which is a custom field on the User object, should be displayed on the claim record. What is the recommended solution to meet the requirement?

label.#text: Use a field update in a workflow rule to copy the team member's claim limit onto the claim record
Use Process Builder to populate the user limit field when the claim is created
Use a cross-object formula to display the user's limit on the claim record
Use a trigger to populate the user limit field when the claim is created

span.em: Technically, all the options can be used to meet the requirement. However, using a cross-object formula is recommended as it is the most straightforward solution to achieve what is required. Cross-object formulas can reference fields on related records. In this case, the claim limit can be made available to the claim record by creating a cross-object formula through Claim > Owner (User) > Claim Limit.

p.em: Relatively, more declarative customization work will be required for workflow rules or Process builder. An Apex trigger would not be required as a declarative option is available.

span.em: The insert DML operation adds one or more sObjects, such as individual accounts or contacts to your data. Insert is analogous to the INSERT statement in SQL.

#text: Given the following value from a Lead record, lastModifiedDate:2016-05-06 03:25:41, what data type should the developer use to retrieve this type of information?

span.em: Time is a value that indicates a particular time. While Date is a value that indicates a particular day. The answer is DateTime, as the lastModifiedDate indicates a particular day and time, an example of a timestamp.

p.em: DateValue is not a valid data type.

#text: Which of the following statements about the IF-ELSE statement are true?

label.#text: An IF-ELSE statement permits a choice to be made between two possible execution paths.
An IF statement can be followed by a discretionary ELSE statement, which executes when the Boolean expression is false.
An IF-ELSE statement provides a secondary path of execution when an IF clause evaluates to true.
An IF-ELSE statement can have any number of possible execution paths.

span.em: The IF-ELSE statement permits a choice to be made between two possible execution paths, and not more. The ELSE statement executes (secondary path) when the IF clause is false.

input.name: check

#text: A developer needs to retrieve the Contact records with a last name that starts with ‘Ab’. What code in the options below will satisfy his requirements?

label.#text: SELECT Id, LastName FROM Contact WHERE LastName LIKE ‘Ab%’
SELECT Id, LastName FROM Contact WHERE LastName IN (‘Ab’)
SELECT Id, LastName FROM Contact WHERE LastName LIKE ‘_Ab’
SELECT Id, LastName FROM Contact WHERE LastName = ‘Ab%’

span.em: The % and _ wildcards are supported for the LIKE operator. The % wildcard matches zero or more characters. The _ wildcard matches exactly one character.

p.em: The IN clause returns records where the field have an exact match in any of the values specified in the IN array. The “LastName LIKE ‘_Ab'” criteria will match three-letter values that end in ‘Ab’. The “LastName = ‘Ab%'” filter will treat % as a literal character and not as a wildcard character.

#text: Before deleting a record, a complex validation needs to be performed to confirm that the record can be deleted by querying a number of objects. What solution would be most appropriate in this situation?

span.em: An Apex trigger would need to be used to perform the validation logic when a record is deleted, and prevent the deletion if the record does not pass validation.

p.em: Process Builder cannot be invoked when a record is deleted. While it is possible to trigger a flow when a record is deleted, it is not capable of preventing a record from being deleted should the validation fail. Validation rules cannot be used on record deletions.

input.name: check

#text: The Salesforce Administrator was given a requirement to display the total cost of products at the time they are added to an opportunity. The product cost is a custom field on the product object and is added as a formula field to the opportunity product object. How would the Salesforce Administrator meet this requirement?

label.#text: Create a roll-up summary field on the opportunity based on the product cost formula field
Create a trigger that queries the product cost values and update the opportunity
Create a workflow rule that copies the product cost to a currency field and create a roll-up summary field based on the currency field
Create a trigger that copies the product cost to a currency field

span.em: Formula fields cannot be used in roll-up summaries if they reference fields on a related object. To meet the requirement, a workflow rule can be configured to copy the value of the product cost formula field to a custom currency field on the opportunity product object. Then, a roll-up summary field can be created on the opportunity object to sum up the values of the custom currency field on each related opportunity product.

p.em: Programmatic customization is not necessary in this scenario as the requirement can be met with declarative options.

#text: Describe the capabilities and use cases for roll-up summary fields.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: A developer is considering writing a trigger to perform data validation before saving a record. What other options can be used to enforce and maintain data quality?

span.em: Validation rules, required fields and restricted picklists can all ensure data quality. Other options include lookup fields with filters and setting fields required on a page layout.

p.em: Escalation rules are used for automated escalation of cases upon meeting a certain criteria. Assignment rules are used for automatically assigning a case or lead to an owner.

#text: Describe when to use declarative automation features vs. Apex classes and triggers.

div.#text: Please select 3 answers for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following is required when defining an Apex Class Method?

span.em: Access modifiers such as ‘public’ or ‘protected’ are optional. Definition modifiers such as ‘virtual’ and ‘abstract’ are optional for defining an Apex class or method. The data type of the value returned by the method is required; void can be used if the method does not return a value. A list of input parameters can be specified for the method. The parameters should be enclosed in parentheses () and separated by commas, each preceded by its data type. If there are no parameters, an empty set of parentheses can be used.

#text: Given a scenario, write Apex classes and use Apex interfaces.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Universal Insurance uses Salesforce for managing claims. Claim is a custom object. If an email is sent from a claimant regarding an existing claim, it should be checked for a unique reference number and if found, attached to the related claim record, and the status of the claim record updated. What feature would be most appropriate for this requirement?

span.em: As a custom object is being used, Email-to-Case cannot be used. Email-to-Case will create a new case from an email sent to a specific address. Email to Custom Object is not an existing feature. While Process builder could be used to update a record or parent record, it could not process the incoming email.

p.em: A custom email handler can be defined to handle inbound emails and perform operations such as creating or updating records based on the email content.

#text: Given a scenario, use declarative functionality and Apex together to automate business logic.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Stock Symbol is a custom field on the Account object. What is the best way to make this field appear on Contact detail page layout?

span.em: Formula fields allow inserting references to fields of a parent object. In this case, Account.Stock_Symbol__c

#text: Describe the capabilities and use cases for formula fields.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following are true about cross-object formula fields?

label.#text: Cross-object formula fields can pull field values from objects that are up to 10 relationships away.
Cross-object formula fields can pull field values from master-detail or lookup parent records.
Cross-object formula fields can pull field values from its child records.
Cross-object formula fields can pull data from a record even if the user does not have access to it.
For every object, cross-object formula fields can be used in 3 roll-up summaries.

span.em: Cross-object Formula Fields can reference field values from related Parent records. Even though a user does not have access to a record, data from this record can still be visible to the user through cross-object formula fields. Formula Fields can reference field values from related Parent objects that are up to 10 relationships away.

#text: Describe the capabilities and use cases for formula fields.

div.#text: Please select 3 answers for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Apex is typically executed in system mode, but which of the following executes code as the current user?

span.em: All Apex code runs in system mode, where the permissions and record sharing of the current user are not taken into account. The exception to this is anonymous blocks that run as the current user.

#text: Given a scenario, write Apex classes and use Apex interfaces.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following tasks are best achieved using Process Builder instead of Workflow Rules?

label.#text: Copying the Account postal code to all child contacts

span.em: Workflow Rules and Processes are both capable of creating task records at multiple intervals (e.g.: after 7 days, 15 days, etc.). A Workflow Rule and Process can both update a field on a parent (master-child relationship is required for workflow rules).

p.em: Between the two, only a Process can submit a record for approval and update child records. Therefore, order submission for approval and copying account postal code to all child contacts can only be achieved by using Process Builder.

#text: Describe the capabilities of the declarative process automation features.

div.#text: Please select 2 answers for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: The Stage field on all related Opportunity records should be updated to 'Closed Lost' when the value of a 'Status' custom field on the Account record is changed to 'Inactive' by a sales user. What should be used to meet this requirement?

span.em: Process Builder should be used to update related child records by using the 'Update Records' action type.

p.em: In this scenario, a record-triggered after-save flow can be created that updates the related Opportunity records after the Account record is saved. However, a flow should only be used if the requirement is too complicated, or if required functionality is not available in Process Builder. An approval process cannot be used to update child records. Workflow rules cannot operate on child records of an object. It must also be noted that cross-object field updates are available for an object's parent record only under certain conditions.

#text: Describe the capabilities of the declarative process automation features.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: How can a developer ensure that a variable 'Day' will only contain specific set of constants such as SUNDAY, MONDAY, ...SATURDAY? What should variable 'Day' be declared as?

span.em: An enum is an abstract data type with values that each take on exactly one of a finite set of identifiers that you specify. Use enumerations (enums) to specify a set of constants.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: How can a developer get all picklist values of a specific field via Apex?

span.em: The getDescribe() method is used to obtain information on the field and then the getPicklistValues method is used to retrieve the picklist values.

#text: Describe how to programmatically access and utilize the object schema.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check

#text: In the following line of code, why can the helloWorld() method be called directly instead of instantiating the myClass?

label.#text: helloWorld is defined as a void method
helloWorld is defined as a static method
myClass is defined as a static class

span.em: A static method, which can be used as a utility method, is called without instantiating the class. The 'static' keyword can only be used with methods, variables, and initialization code, but not classes.

p.em: The return type 'void' means that the method does not return a value. The 'public' keyword is an access modifier and only affects accessibility to the class for other code.

#text: Given a scenario, write Apex classes and use Apex interfaces.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following DML operations will allow other records in a list to be inserted even if there are records that failed?

span.em: The second parameter of the Database insert method is an optional "allOrNone" parameter, which specifies whether or not partial success is allowed. If set to false and one of the records fails in the insert operation, the remaining records in the list can still succeed. If set to true and one of the records fails in the operation, an error will be thrown and the entire transaction will be rolled back. If unspecified, this parameter defaults to true.

p.em: The insert sObjectsToCreate and upsert sObjectsToCreate DML statements do not allow partial success.

#text: Given a scenario, write SOSL, SOQL, and DML statements in Apex.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Universal Containers would like to see a Red / Yellow / Green Traffic Light representation on the Opportunity detail page, based on the value in the Opportunity Probability field. What would you use to achieve this?

span.em: An image (stored in documents) can be displayed conditionally using a formula field using the IMAGE() function.

#text: Describe the capabilities and use cases for formula fields.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following can be used to update existing standard and custom fields on child records automatically when a parent record is modified?

span.em: Process Builder can be used to update related records including child records. An Apex Trigger can also be used to update related child records automatically. A Workflow Rule can be used to update only the master record that is related to the child record, using a cross-object field update action. Although a cross-object formula field can be used to reference and display values in merge fields from a parent object if an object is on the detail side of a master-detail relationship, it cannot be used to ‘update’ existing fields on the detail records.

#text: Describe the capabilities of the declarative process automation features.

div.#text: Please select 2 answers for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: What should a developer consider when using the upsert operation to insert and update records?

label.#text: Using the upsert operation, the administrator can either insert, update or delete a record in one call.
Using the upsert operation, the administrator can either insert or update an existing record in one call.

To determine whether a record already exists, the upsert statement or Database method uses the ID of the record as the key to match records, a custom external ID field, or a standard field with the idLookup attribute set to true.
If the key is matched multiple times, the existing object record is updated based on the latest match.
If the key is not matched, a new object record is created. If the key is matched once, the existing object record is updated.

span.em: If the key is matched multiple times, then an error is generated and the object record is neither inserted nor updated. An upsert is capable of inserting or updating a record, but it will not be able to delete.

span.em: The loop will iterate until such time the condition of the while block is evaluated as false. Prior to this, the variable z is equal to 16.

#text: Given a scenario, use and apply Apex control flow statements.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following access modifiers are supported in Apex?

span.em: Supported Apex access modifiers are: Private – this is the default, and means that the method or variable is accessible only within the Apex class in which it is defined. Protected – the method or variable is visible to any inner classes in the defining Apex class, and to the classes that extend the defining Apex class. Public – the method or variable can be used by any Apex in this application or namespace. Global – the method or variable can be used by any Apex code that has access to the class, not just the Apex code in the same application.

p.em: ‘Default’ and ‘Restricted’ do not exist and are both invalid access modifier terms.

#text: Given a scenario, write Apex classes and use Apex interfaces.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

span.#text: A developer notices that the code below returns only 20 Account records though she expected 60. Which of the following is true regarding SOSL query limits?

#text: FIND {test} RETURNING Account(id), Contact, Opportunity LIMIT 60

label.#text: Results were evenly distributed among the objects returned.
Limits cannot be set in SOSL queries
Limits have to be individually assigned per object.

#text: If a limit is set on the entire query, results are evenly distributed among the objects returned.
Limits can also be set per individual object.
Describe how to use basic SOSL, SOQL and DML statements

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following requirements could a developer use a formula field for?

label.#text: Concatenating field values from long text area fields or Description fields.
Displaying a traffic light image of red, yellow, or green based on case priority.
Creating a link to an application outside of Salesforce, passing parameters including the session Id.
Calculating a value based on other values and merge fields in Web-to-Lead forms.

span.em: A formula field can return an image by using the IMAGE function. A formula field can also return a link with the session Id as a parameter by using the HYPERLINK and GETSESSIONID functions.

p.em: Formula fields do not support Long/Rich/Encrypted Text Area fields. Custom formula fields are not available in Connect Offline, Web-to-Lead forms, or Web-to-Case forms.

#text: Describe the capabilities and use cases for formula fields.

div.#text: Please select 2 answers for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following field types can a Roll-Up Summary field calculate?

span.em: If SUM is selected as the roll-up type, number, currency, and percent fields can be calculated.

p.em: If MIN or MAX is selected as the roll-up type, number, currency, percent, date, and date/time fields are available.

#text: Describe the capabilities and use cases for roll-up summary fields.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: There are several escape sequences that can be used in queries so that a user query can contain special characters. Which of the following are valid escape sequences?

span.em: SOQL defines several escape sequences to include special characters in queries. It is possible to escape new lines, carriage returns, tabs, quotes, and more. The escape character for SOQL is the backslash character (\).

p.em: However, '\a' and '\c' are not valid escape sequences.

#text: Given a scenario, write SOSL, SOQL, and DML statements in Apex.

div.#text: Please select 3 answers for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: An organization has enabled Multiple Currencies. A developer needs to calculate the total of the Estimated_value__c on CampaignMember object using a roll-up summary field on Campaign object named Total_estimated_value__c. What will be the currency of the Total_estimated_value__c field?

label.#text: The field values in Estimated_value__c from CampaignMember object are summed up, and the Total_estimated_value__c field is shown as a Number field on the Campaign.

The field values in Estimated_value__c from CampaignMember object are converted into the currency of the current user, and the Total_estimated_value__c is shown using the currency of the current user on the Campaign.
The field values in Estimated_value__c from CampaignMember object are converted into the currency of the Campaign, and the Total_estimated_value__c is shown using the currency of the Campaign.
The field values in Estimated_value__c are converted into the currency of the majority of the CampaignMember records, and the Total_estimated_value__c is shown using that currency.

span.em: If your organization uses multiple currencies, the currency of the master record determines the currency of the roll-up summary field. For example, if the master and detail records are in different currencies, the detail record value is converted into the currency of the master record.

#text: Describe the capabilities and use cases for roll-up summary fields.

div.#text: Please select 1 answer for this question.

input.name: check
input.style: float: left; margin-right: 10px; margin-left: -10px; display: none;

#text: Which of the following are valid Apex variables?

span.em: Currency is not a valid Apex data type. Instead, the Decimal type is used. Also, Number is not a valid data type. Integer, Long, Decimal and Double are primitive data types available to use when working with numbers or numeric values.
